verses.verse: I said <S%H559><s%> in my heart <S%H3820><s%>, Come now <S%H3212><s%>, I will prove <S%H5254><s%> thee with mirth <S%H8057><s%>; therefore enjoy <S%H7200><s%> pleasure <S%H2896><s%>: and <S%H1892><s%>, behold, this also was vanity.
I said <S%H559><s%> of laughter <S%H7814><s%>, It is mad <S%H1984><s%>; and of mirth <S%H8057><s%>, What <S%H2090><s%> doeth it <S%H6213><s%>?

I searched <S%H8446><s%> in my heart <S%H3820><s%> how to cheer <S%H4900><s%> my <S%H1320><s%> flesh with wine <S%H3196><s%>, my heart <S%H3820><s%> yet guiding <S%H5090><s%> me with wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and how to lay hold <S%H270><s%> on folly <S%H5531><s%>, till I might see <S%H7200><s%> what it was good <S%H2896><s%> for the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%> that they should do <S%H6213><s%> under heaven <S%H8064><s%> all <S%H4557><s%> the days <S%H3117><s%> of their life <S%H2416><s%>.
I made me great <S%H1431><s%> works <S%H4639><s%>; I builded <S%H1129><s%> me houses <S%H1004><s%>; I planted <S%H5193><s%> me vineyards <S%H3754><s%>;
I made <S%H6213><s%> me gardens <S%H1593><s%> and parks <S%H6508><s%>, and I planted <S%H5193><s%> trees <S%H6086><s%> in them of all kinds of fruit <S%H6529><s%>;
I made <S%H6213><s%> me pools <S%H1295><s%> of water <S%H4325><s%>, to water <S%H8248><s%> therefrom the forest <S%H3293><s%> where trees <S%H3293><s%> were reared <S%H6779><s%>;

I bought <S%H7069><s%> men-servants <S%H5650><s%> and maid-servants <S%H8198><s%>, and had servants born <S%H1121><s%> in my house <S%H1004><s%>; also I had great <S%H7235><s%> possessions <S%H4735><s%> of herds <S%H6629><s%> and flocks <S%H1241><s%>, above all that were before <S%H6440><s%> me in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>;

I gathered <S%H3664><s%> me also silver <S%H3701><s%> and gold <S%H2091><s%>, and the treasure <S%H5459><s%> of kings <S%H4428><s%> and of the provinces <S%H4082><s%>; I gat <S%H6213><s%> me men-singers <S%H7891><s%> and women-singers <S%H7891><s%>, and the delights <S%H8588><s%> of the sons <S%H1121><s%> of men <S%H120><s%>, musical instruments <S%H7705><s%>, and that of all sorts.
So I was great <S%H1431><s%>, and increased <S%H3254><s%> more than all that were before <S%H6440><s%> me in Jerusalem <S%H3389><s%>: also my wisdom <S%H2451><s%> remained with me <S%H5975><s%>.

And whatsoever mine eyes <S%H5869><s%> desired <S%H7592><s%> I kept <S%H680><s%> not from them <S%H4513><s%>; I withheld not my heart <S%H3820><s%> from any joy <S%H8057><s%>; for my heart <S%H3820><s%> rejoiced <S%H8056><s%> because of all my labor <S%H5999><s%>; and this was my portion <S%H2506><s%> from all my labor <S%H5999><s%>.

Then I looked <S%H6437><s%> on all the works <S%H4639><s%> that my hands <S%H3027><s%> had wrought <S%H6213><s%>, and on the labor <S%H5999><s%> that I had labored <S%H5999><s%> to do <S%H6213><s%>; and <S%H1892><s%>, behold, all was vanity and a striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind <S%H7307><s%>, and there was no profit <S%H3504><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>.

And I turned <S%H6437><s%> myself to behold <S%H7200><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and madness <S%H1947><s%>, and folly <S%H5531><s%>: for what can the man <S%H120><s%> do that cometh <S%H935><s%> after <S%H310><s%> the king <S%H4428><s%>? even that which hath been done <S%H6213><s%> long ago <S%H3528><s%>.
Then I saw <S%H7200><s%> that <S%H3426><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%> excelleth <S%H3504><s%> folly <S%H5531><s%>, as far as light <S%H216><s%> excelleth <S%H3504><s%> darkness <S%H2822><s%>.

The wise man <S%H2450><s%>'s eyes <S%H5869><s%> are in his head <S%H7218><s%>, and the fool <S%H3684><s%> walketh <S%H1980><s%> in darkness <S%H2822><s%>: and yet I perceived <S%H3045><s%> that one <S%H259><s%> event <S%H4745><s%> happeneth to them all <S%H7136><s%>.

Then <S%H227><s%> said <S%H559><s%> I in my heart <S%H3820><s%>, As it happeneth <S%H4745><s%> to the fool <S%H3684><s%>, so will it happen <S%H7136><s%> even to me <S%H1571><s%>; and why was I then more <S%H3148><s%> wise <S%H2449><s%>? Then said <S%H1696><s%> I in my heart <S%H3820><s%>, that this also is vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

For of the wise <S%H2450><s%> man <S%H5973><s%>, even as of the fool <S%H3684><s%>, there is no remembrance <S%H2146><s%> for ever <S%H5769><s%>; seeing <S%H3528><s%> that in the days <S%H3117><s%> to come <S%H935><s%> all will have been long forgotten <S%H7911><s%>. And how doth the wise <S%H2450><s%> man die <S%H4191><s%> even as the fool <S%H3684><s%>!

So I hated <S%H8130><s%> life <S%H2416><s%>, because the work <S%H4639><s%> that is wrought <S%H6213><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%> was grievous <S%H7451><s%> unto me <S%H1892><s%>; for all is vanity and a striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind <S%H7307><s%>.

And I hated <S%H8130><s%> all my labor <S%H5999><s%> wherein I labored <S%H5999><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>, seeing that I must leave <S%H3240><s%> it unto the man <S%H120><s%> that shall be after me <S%H310><s%>.

And who knoweth <S%H3045><s%> whether he will be a wise <S%H2450><s%> man or a fool <S%H5530><s%>? yet will he have rule <S%H7980><s%> over all my labor <S%H5999><s%> wherein I have labored <S%H5999><s%>, and wherein I have showed myself wise <S%H2449><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>. This also is vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

Therefore I turned about <S%H5437><s%> to cause <S%H2976><s%> my heart <S%H3820><s%> to despair <S%H2976><s%> concerning all the labor <S%H5999><s%> wherein I had labored <S%H5999><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>.

For there is <S%H3426><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> whose labor <S%H5999><s%> is with wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and with knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, and with skilfulness <S%H3788><s%>; yet to a man <S%H120><s%> that hath not labored <S%H5998><s%> therein shall he leave <S%H5414><s%> it for his portion <S%H2506><s%>. This also is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and a great <S%H7227><s%> evil <S%H7451><s%>.

For what hath <S%H1933><s%> a man <S%H120><s%> of all his labor <S%H5999><s%>, and of the striving <S%H7475><s%> of his heart <S%H3820><s%>, wherein <S%H1931><s%> he laboreth <S%H6001><s%> under the sun <S%H8121><s%>?

For all his days <S%H3117><s%> are but sorrows <S%H4341><s%>, and his travail <S%H6045><s%> is grief <S%H3708><s%>; yea <S%H3915><s%>, even in the night his heart <S%H3820><s%> taketh no rest <S%H7901><s%>. This also is vanity <S%H1892><s%>.

There is nothing better <S%H2896><s%> for a man <S%H120><s%> than that he should eat <S%H398><s%> and drink <S%H8354><s%>, and make his soul <S%H5315><s%> enjoy <S%H7200><s%> good <S%H2896><s%> in his labor <S%H5999><s%>. This <S%H2090><s%> also I saw <S%H7200><s%>, that it is from the hand <S%H3027><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>.
For who can eat <S%H398><s%>, or who can have enjoyment <S%H2363><s%>, more than I <S%H2351><s%>?

For to the man <S%H120><s%> that pleaseth <S%H2896><s%> him <S%H6440><s%> God giveth <S%H5414><s%> wisdom <S%H2451><s%>, and knowledge <S%H1847><s%>, and joy <S%H8057><s%>; but to the sinner <S%H2398><s%> he giveth <S%H5414><s%> travail <S%H6045><s%>, to gather <S%H622><s%> and to heap up <S%H3664><s%>, that he may give <S%H5414><s%> to him that <S%H6440><s%> pleaseth <S%H2896><s%> God <S%H430><s%>. This also is vanity <S%H1892><s%> and a striving <S%H7469><s%> after wind <S%H7307><s%>.
